item.title: Amazon EMR Serverless - Glue Hive MetaStore Integration ‚öíÔ∏è
item.description:
Amazon EMR Serverless - Glue Hive MetaStore Integration

Introduction

  1. What is Amazon EMR?

    • Amazon EMR is a cloud big data platform running large-scale distributed data processing jobs, interactive SQL queries, and machine learning (ML) applications using open-source analytics frameworks such as Apache Spark, Apache Hive, and Presto.
    • Understanding clusters and nodes
      • A cluster is a collection of Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instances. An instance in the cluster is called a node, and each node has role within the cluster, referred to as the node type.
      • The node types in Amazon EMR are as follows:
        • Master node: A node that manages the cluster by running software components to coordinate data distribution and tasks among other nodes for processing.
        • Core node: A node with software components that run tasks and store data in your cluster‚Äôs Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS).
        • Task node: A node with software components that only runs tasks and does not store data in HDFS.

  2. What is Amazon EMR Serverless?

item.title: Transform Data with AWS Glue DataBrew
item.description:
Transform Data with AWS Glue DataBrew

Overview

  • We all are fascinated with various analytical outcomes like different kinds of visualization. But do we know that 50% of the time is just spent cleansing, understanding, & exploring your data? Also, it is a combustion process, multiple iterations, time-consuming, etc.?

  • AWS launched the Glue DataBrew service to focus more on the business use-case and simplify the preparation activities. This session will focus on the Introduction of the Databrew service, different functionality, followed by a quick demo

item.title: Catalog Data using AWS Glue Data Catalog üìñ
item.description:
Introduction

  • Glue Data Catalog is an AWS native service that allows persisting, tag, and extends metadata in a similar fashion like an Apache Hive metastore. Every AWS account holds one AWS Glue Data Catalog in every region.

  • It offers a consistent store where multiple sources can persist and lookup metadata to organize the data and leverage it to query and transform the data.

  • Following are the additional extensions to Glue Data Catalog:
